Job Purpose

The Associate will manage a portfolio of clients and ensure the delivery of the scope of services detailed in the service agreements with our clients. The Associate will also ensure adherence and compliance with all TMF and Department reporting and required processes and filing.

The client scope of services may include HRIS system management payroll

column1: The Travel and Expense Receipt Auditor will be responsible for the audit review of expense reports to identify compliance with the corporate T&E and P-Card policies. This position enforces compliance with the required receipts policies.
Demonstrate strong customer service skills to include timeliness
Confidentiality is critical due to the personal information accessible with corporate card programs.
Ability to effectively communicate both written and orally
Work independently as well as in a team environment.
Daily and weekly audit of approved expense reports to ensure the proper receipts are attached according to the T&E and P-Card policies.
Prepare report from Concur for the weekly audit period and sort data for the compliance review
Communicate with employees to request the required receipt be attached to Concur expense report and follow through until receipt attached
Adhere to the corporate T&E and P-card policies when conducting expense report audits
Provide support and clarity to end users for Concur expense report preparation to ensure alignment with the corporate policies
Maintain confidentiality with respect to the card holder information
Act as a back up to the Travel and Expense Specialist
Global Help Desk as required: Provide timely support and a high level of customer service to internal customers to ensure timely resolution and satisfaction. Handling high volume of emails
column2: help desk tickets and calls pertaining to the corporate card programs and expense management in Concur. Point of contact for internal customers. Build and maintain effective relationships with the internal customers.

column1: Should have at least 2 years of experience in a travel and expense position

column1: {company} Malaysia is a processing centre of operational excellence supporting 10 countries across three geographical time zones. The country employs a Global Operating Model to maximize efficiencies across times zones and supports a 24/5 operational capability.

This role involves working as part of a team in charge of RBC I&TS Trust Client Invoicing. You will be responsible for recording invoices and processing payments in a timely and accurate manner while effectively and efficiently keeping our reconciliation breaks to a minimum. You will also be participating and supporting in projects and initiatives to strengthen the process and reduce operational risk.
This role will support Luxembourg region with working hours between 12PM and 9PM.
To work as part of a team producing approximately 300 client invoices in an accurate and timely basis each month.
To collect payments from our clients (RBC I&TS revenue) as a result of the invoices we have issued.
To effectively and efficiently keep our accounts receivable to a minimum by maintaining a high level of accuracy and service to the clients and business units we support

Tertiary education in Finance and Banking.
Demonstrated attention to detail coupled with good problem solving skills; analytical and numeric reasoning skills.
Proven flexibility in accommodating different personalities

Job Purpose

The Senior Associate will assists the Accounting team in daily deliverables to ensure excellent service to clients.

Job Responsibilities:

  • Bookkeeper / Preparer who performs daily work from simple to medium complexity
column2: including closing full set of book
column3: preparation of annual financial statements & scheduling
column6: preparation of tax returns with tax computations
column8:
and other tailor made management reports/ financial analysis.
  • Assist in liaising with auditors and tax agents.
  • Ensure all accounts portfolio assigned are completed on time for reporting purposes
  • Ensure all accounting documentation and information are properly stored/filed
  • Completes time sheets in an accurate and timely manner.
  • Perform other duties as assigned.

column1:
Key Requirements:

  • Fresh graduate of Bachelor's degree in Accountancy or Business or equivalent e.g Diploma holder in Accountancy or Business with 1 year working experience
  • Sound knowledge of international and local accounting principles and practices and financial reporting
  • Attention to detail and accuracy
  • Intermediate Excel skill set and willingness to learn cloud accounting system
  • Good command of both spoken and written English
  • Demonstrated self-starter with high initiative and ability to work independently and as part of a team

What’s in it for you?

  • Our offices are easily accessible by public transportation (LRT & Monorail)
  • Flexible working arrangements
  • Work with colleagues and clients around the world on interesting and challenging work
  • We provide internal career opportunities so you can take your career further within TMF

column1: We want to enrich the millions of lives and businesses in our region a little more each day through our inclusive financial services. If being part of a dynamic team that is changing the way people transact in daily lives sounds exciting to you

Job brief

We are looking for a Marketing Intern to join our team for at least 3 months with the opportunity to become a permanent part of our organization upon successful completion. You will assist the Marketing Manager in all marketing-related activities giving you the proper first-hand experience needed in the exciting world of fintech.

Expect to hone some practical skills such as:

  • Campaign planning & launch
  • Internal & external stakeholder management
  • Budgeting
  • On-ground activations & event management
  • Data driven analysis & competitor analysis

• Communications/PR/Media/Marketing equivalent - related studies
  • Strong English/Bahasa Malaysia written & spoken communication skills required
  • Detail-oriented and resourceful in completing projects; excellent communication and organizational skills
  • Able to use Microsoft Office
column3:
Office and Excel
  • Duration of internship: Minimum 3 months (Ideally to start immediately in November)

column1: Ria Financial Services is the third-largest global money transfer company and a division of the North American public company Euronet Worldwide (Nasdaq: EEFT). RIA is a global leader in remittances and is a recognized benchmark in both the quality and reliability of the service it offers to the general public.
We are looking for an enthusiastic Customer Service Representative to join our friendly team in the Kuala Lumpur. In this role
column2: you would provide information to our customers about their transactions and resolve any queries they have. Your main responsibilities will include:

column1: Attracts and retains potential customers by answering product and service questions; suggesting information about other products and services.
Respond to all emails via Zendesk in a timely manner.
Manage Customer Service queries received on Ria Chat and selected Social Media sites
Understands the importance of Privacy and follows the legislation and procedures accordingly
Maintains customer records by updating customer information.

Resolves product or service problems by clarifying the customer's complaint; determining the cause; selecting and explaining the best solution to solve the problem; expediting correction or adjustment; following up to ensure resolution and escalate the issue if necessary.
Recommends changes that may be needed to management by collecting customer information and analyzing customer needs.
Contributes to the CS team by assisting in accomplishing department goals.

Manage excellent relationships with all Ria's Stakeholders
Completes assigned tasks and shift responsibilities daily
Develops and Maintains relationships throughout the organization between agents
Maintains customer satisfaction at high levels.
Ensure the quality of call standards are met for the department.
Minimum studies required: Technical or Bachelor degree
Good knowledge of MS Office and Internet Explorer.
At least 3 year´s work experience in customer service or call center positions.
Advanced level of English and Malay
Excellent communications skills (both oral and written).

column1: We are currently seeking an experienced professional to join our team in the role of Assistant Manager Operations.

market specific requirements/procedures and performance of various systems in securities processing.

leave management and process prioritization by allocating/reallocating resources across the various markets.

  • To co-ordinate and assist the management team while initiating business recovery measures. To monitor Operational Risks and implement risk mitigating plans.
  • To support Business Continuity Plan (BCP) by implementing the changes and adhering the BCP Group guidelines as well as HSS BCP guidelines.

column1: The T&O Governance and Assurance Department (TOGA) is part of Country T&O which is mandated with a role as an independent assurance and advisory function designed to add value in improving the effectiveness and quality of the T&O’s operating control systems.

The Department’s main responsibility is to provide support to the T&O - Operations Centres and IT departments on risk and control related matters. The Department is responsible for undertaking various activities including assurance and process reviews.

The Department also promotes and reinforces a consistent approach to the escalation and management of risk events as well as the application of controls to mitigate associated risks. It facilitates management governance through the provision of reports on significant risk events

Job Description:

• SME Associate is a 6 months sales program where we train and expose the new hires to the art of selling and credit evaluation.

• Credit skills are essential as this sales involves pitching to SME business owners.

• This journey will prepare you for a successful career in becoming a Relationship Manager or Team Leads in the future.

The Role Comprises of:

• Responsible for overall business development on SME loan and deposit products.

• Managing customer relationships with an aim to develop and sustain business flow to achieve bank’s business objective.

• Other duties include developing and implementing marketing plans as well as administering and monitoring loan accounts

• Solicit and develop new client relationships to drive the SME business to new heights

• Enhance existing customer relationships and cross-sell the Bank's products

The Role: Offshore Field Development Technical Research Analyst

The Team: This role is part of the Asia Pacific upstream technical research team supporting key products generating E&P and offshore market intelligence. The data collected goes into the Petrodata suite of products
column2: which covers offshore field development reports along with rigs
column4: subsea construction and seismic vessel reports.

column1: Impact: This role is responsible for collecting and reporting on offshore field development activity in the Asia Pacific region and will actively source for details regarding the assigned region and subsea construction vessels. The person would eventually be considered an expert in the offshore sector.

This is a critical position in support of the company’s varied customers who participate in the offshore construction market. These customers include international and state-controlled oil and gas companies

• Join a dynamic regional research team focused on generating leading upstream research that supports workflow solutions driving customer success.
  • Development path to becoming one of our regional upstream subject matter experts
column2:
building strategic relationships and bringing thought leadership.
  • Gain additional capabilities through collaboration with other internal stakeholders – wider regional and insight research teams; commercial; advisory solutions; product development

column1: • Collecting and reporting on offshore field development activities in the assigned region particularly via phone calling
column2:
to establish and maintain relevant industry contacts
  • Gathering accurate data of assigned offshore subsea construction vessels
  • Updating and maintaining the Company's proprietary databases including data input and data checks
  • Analysis of data/news for contact conversation and potential contributions to forecasting reports
  • Providing support to related editorial and market research efforts as assigned and customer support when necessary

column1:
• Preferred two years’ work experience and familiarity with the offshore oil and gas industry

column1: 350|Finance Operation Analyst|Alpha Trade Pty Ltd|Kuala Lumpur

We are currently recruiting {job} in an exciting Australian regulated financial services start-up company which concentrates in offering trading in financial derivatives to institutional clients. The Firm is profitable and intend to acquire an FCA (UK Financial Regulator) derivatives broker-dealer license in 2023 so the firms will form part of a consolidated group.
All our client are smaller institutional derivatives broker-dealers
column3: family offices and hedge funds and we offer trading in Margin FX
column6: Metals and finally Digital Assets (Crypto’s) to eligible clients.

column1: The role will require acquiring an understanding of trading
column4: commodity and crypto derivatives to fully understand what drives our revenues and costs. This individual will oversee the Firm’s Financial Control Team.

column1: The candidates will work across closely Risk and Operation functions overseeing the reconciling both client and executing broker trading platforms
column2: Middle and Back-office systems. They will be responsible for ensuring that the Firms management accounts (QuickBooks experience is necessary) are maintained and accurate on a daily basis as it is a regulatory requirement to ensure that the Firm is adequately capitalised at all times. Training will be provided to illustrate how the capital adequacy calculation is performed.

column1: {company} was acquired by EU & AUS owners in 2021 and re-launched itself as an institutional derivatives broker. Our first months’ trading volumes exceeded USD 3 billion and the firm has grown sustainably since its acquisition was profitable in 2021 and is significantly more profitable in 2022.
The Firm is regulated by Australian Securities and Investments Commission
column2: and hold an Australian Financial Services License. We split the companies operations between Sydney (Technology & Trading) and KL (Risk & Operations) alongside a small team in London. Over time we expect this balance will shift towards more KL staff and the KL Operation will be the hub for each regulated entity that we acquire. As such this individual will need to have an understanding of how to consolidate the various legal entities books as strategically we intend to have a minimum of two regulated brokers under the holding company with the possibility of a share of a European Bank.

column1: This individual will often work cross-functionally with internal business units and gain access to executive level personnel on a daily basis so must have strong communication skills
column2: ideas and be extremely detail oriented as we produce and analyse vast amounts of data (with tools we have built). They will work within and alongside a team of programmers and those with a Finance/Economics domain knowledge background.

column1: · Produce a regulatory compliance Daily Reconciliation (MS Excel) which you will be trained to do which measure the Firms capital excess over clients monies every day
· Identify any Reconciliation breaks and identify them and resolve the queries via internal partners or external vendors such as Banks and Liquidity Providers
· Maintain the Firms financial records (QuickBooks) by booking summary level data (mainly available from the Daily Reconciliation and the Firms management accounts on a daily basis
· Factor new products and clients into the accounting process in line with regulatory requirements
· Forecast the groups P&L and expenses and help assist the board(s) with strategic planning for the group
· Identify and solve weaknesses within the organization systems and controls from a fiduciary and accounting perspective
· Be the point person alongside you support staff to ensure audits are completed in a timely manner without any regulatory breaches or qualified audit points

· Oversee robust maintenance of the Firms’ books in an environment whereby emerging technologies will be adopted as the firm will deploy new trading technologies over time as the business evolves so change management experience is a must

column2: and cascade knowledge within the team to maintain a supervisory role which initially requiring a very hands-on role within that department.

column1: · We envisage the candidate to have an accounting qualification
column2: ACCA approved and have worked in a similar role in a new business for at least three to four years in a small to medium sized regulated financial services company. We have the compliance support in place to assist with ensuring the candidate acquires the relevant accounting and regulatory capital adequacy rules for both Australia and the UK.
QuickBooks and regular proficiency in MS Office Suite.

column1: · Strong written and verbal communication skills are absolutely critical as you will report directly to the CEO and the Board collectively. We expect the candidate to reach C-Suite level of one of the regulated entities within two years of joining the firm (subject to regulatory approval)
· Knowledge of financial products and specifically derivatives will be an enormous advantage.
· This is an extraordinary opportunity to join a fast growing regulated financial services company with a strong strategic vision to build this into a large group of regulated firms’
· The candidate will be supported by an executive team who are highly respected in the industry across the globe and have between them been approved by the Federal Reserve

column1:
Job description

We are currently recruiting Finance Operation Analyst in an exciting Australian regulated financial services start-up company which concentrates in offering trading in financial derivatives to institutional clients. The Firm is profitable and intend to acquire an FCA (UK Financial Regulator) derivatives broker-dealer license in 2023 so the firms will form part of a consolidated group.

All our client are smaller institutional derivatives broker-dealers
column3: family offices and hedge funds and we offer trading in Margin FX
column6:
Metals and finally Digital Assets (Crypto’s) to eligible clients.

The role will require acquiring an understanding of trading
column9:
commodity and crypto derivatives to fully understand what drives our revenues and costs. This individual will oversee the Firm’s Financial Control Team.

The candidates will work across closely Risk and Operation functions overseeing the reconciling both client and executing broker trading platforms
column10:
Middle and Back-office systems. They will be responsible for ensuring that the Firms management accounts (QuickBooks experience is necessary) are maintained and accurate on a daily basis as it is a regulatory requirement to ensure that the Firm is adequately capitalised at all times. Training will be provided to illustrate how the capital adequacy calculation is performed.

Alpha Trade Pty Ltd was acquired by EU & AUS owners in 2021 and re-launched itself as an institutional derivatives broker. Our first months’ trading volumes exceeded USD 3 billion and the firm has grown sustainably since its acquisition was profitable in 2021 and is significantly more profitable in 2022.

The Firm is regulated by Australian Securities and Investments Commission
column11:
and hold an Australian Financial Services License. We split the companies operations between Sydney (Technology & Trading) and KL (Risk & Operations) alongside a small team in London. Over time we expect this balance will shift towards more KL staff and the KL Operation will be the hub for each regulated entity that we acquire. As such this individual will need to have an understanding of how to consolidate the various legal entities books as strategically we intend to have a minimum of two regulated brokers under the holding company with the possibility of a share of a European Bank.

This individual will often work cross-functionally with internal business units and gain access to executive level personnel on a daily basis so must have strong communication skills
column12:
ideas and be extremely detail oriented as we produce and analyse vast amounts of data (with tools we have built). They will work within and alongside a team of programmers and those with a Finance/Economics domain knowledge background.

Responsibilities

· Produce a regulatory compliance Daily Reconciliation (MS Excel) which you will be trained to do which measure the Firms capital excess over clients monies every day

· Identify any Reconciliation breaks and identify them and resolve the queries via internal partners or external vendors such as Banks and Liquidity Providers

· Maintain the Firms financial records (QuickBooks) by booking summary level data (mainly available from the Daily Reconciliation and the Firms management accounts on a daily basis

· Factor new products and clients into the accounting process in line with regulatory requirements

· Forecast the groups P&L and expenses and help assist the board(s) with strategic planning for the group

· Identify and solve weaknesses within the organization systems and controls from a fiduciary and accounting perspective

· Be the point person alongside you support staff to ensure audits are completed in a timely manner without any regulatory breaches or qualified audit points

· Oversee robust maintenance of the Firms’ books in an environment whereby emerging technologies will be adopted as the firm will deploy new trading technologies over time as the business evolves so change management experience is a must

· Cross training
column13:
and cascade knowledge within the team to maintain a supervisory role which initially requiring a very hands-on role within that department.

Qualifications

· We envisage the candidate to have an accounting qualification
column14:
ACCA approved and have worked in a similar role in a new business for at least three to four years in a small to medium sized regulated financial services company. We have the compliance support in place to assist with ensuring the candidate acquires the relevant accounting and regulatory capital adequacy rules for both Australia and the UK.

· Highly proficient in MS Excel
column15:
QuickBooks and regular proficiency in MS Office Suite.

· Strong written and verbal communication skills are absolutely critical as you will report directly to the CEO and the Board collectively. We expect the candidate to reach C-Suite level of one of the regulated entities within two years of joining the firm (subject to regulatory approval)

· Knowledge of financial products and specifically derivatives will be an enormous advantage.

Opportunity

· This is an extraordinary opportunity to join a fast growing regulated financial services company with a strong strategic vision to build this into a large group of regulated firms’

· The candidate will be supported by an executive team who are highly respected in the industry across the globe and have between them been approved by the Federal Reserve
column17:
ASIC and other regulatory bodies

· They have all held multiple executive positions across an array of firms ranging the worlds’ top investment banks to being pivotal in multiple starts which they later sold

· A Discretionary Bonus scheme is available to ALL employees and it is a true meritocracy so you may be rewarded based on personal and company performance in it excess of your superiors. Titles mean nothing to us. It is about talent

performance and growth potential within the company

column1: AEON Credit Service is a leading consumer financing provider with business operations in Japan

Process reengineering/automation to reduce redundancy whilst improving productivitiy and efficiency.
